checklists.title: Infrastructure - ISO 27001:2022 Compliance
checklists.description: Comprehensive security checklist based on ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Annex A controls relevant to infrastructure security. Covers organizational controls (A.5) for policies, roles, and threat intelligence; physical controls (A.7) for premises protection and equipment security; and technological controls (A.8) for endpoint devices, access rights, malware protection, vulnerability management, network security, and secure configuration. This checklist ensures infrastructure assets are assessed against the latest ISO 27001:2022 standard requirements.

items.question: Is there a formally approved and published information security policy that covers infrastructure components, and is it reviewed at planned intervals or when significant changes occur (A.5.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Approved information security policy document with version history, review dates, and sign-off by senior management.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review information security policy for infrastructure coverage

items.question: Are information security roles and responsibilities for infrastructure management clearly defined and allocated, including separation of duties where conflicts of interest exist (A.5.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify infrastructure security roles and responsibilities allocation

items.question: Is there a formal process for segregation of conflicting duties and areas of responsibility to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of infrastructure assets (A.5.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess segregation of duties for infrastructure administration

items.question: Does the organization maintain contact with relevant authorities (e.g., law enforcement, regulatory bodies, utility providers) for infrastructure-related incidents and compliance matters (A.5.5)?
items.expectedEvidence: Documented contact list of relevant authorities with roles, phone numbers, and escalation procedures.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify contact registry with relevant authorities

items.question: Is threat intelligence related to infrastructure gathered, analyzed, and used to inform security decisions, including known vulnerabilities, threat actors targeting similar environments, and emerging attack vectors (A.5.7)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate threat intelligence program for infrastructure threats

items.question: Is information security integrated into project management for all infrastructure projects, ensuring security requirements are identified and addressed throughout the project lifecycle (A.5.8)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify security integration in infrastructure project management

items.question: Is a complete and accurate inventory of infrastructure assets maintained, including hardware, virtual machines, network equipment, and cloud resources, with designated owners (A.5.9)?
items.expectedEvidence: Asset inventory export showing all infrastructure assets with owner, classification, location, and last-verified date.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate infrastructure asset inventory completeness

items.question: Is there a defined acceptable use policy for infrastructure resources (servers, network equipment, storage) and are users made aware of it upon gaining access (A.5.10)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify acceptable use policy for infrastructure resources

items.question: Are supplier agreements and third-party contracts for infrastructure services (hosting, colocation, cloud IaaS) reviewed to ensure they include adequate information security requirements and service levels (A.5.19)?
items.expectedEvidence: Sample supplier contracts showing security clauses, SLAs, right-to-audit clauses, and incident notification requirements.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review supplier agreements for infrastructure security clauses

items.question: Is information security addressed in the ICT supply chain, including requirements for suppliers of infrastructure components (hardware, firmware, software) to manage security risks throughout the supply chain (A.5.21)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess ICT supply chain security for infrastructure components

items.question: Are security perimeters defined and used to protect areas containing information processing facilities and critical infrastructure (data centers, server rooms, network closets) (A.7.1)?

checklists.title: Infrastructure - PCI DSS v4.0
checklists.description: Comprehensive security checklist based on the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) version 4.0 for infrastructure environments that store, process, or transmit cardholder data. Covers Requirement 1 (Network Security Controls), Requirement 2 (Secure Configurations), Requirement 5 (Malware Protection), Requirement 6 (Secure Systems and Software), Requirement 10 (Logging and Monitoring), Requirement 11 (Security Testing), and Requirement 12 (Security Policies). This checklist provides actionable questions for assessing PCI DSS v4.0 compliance of infrastructure assets within the cardholder data environment (CDE) and connected systems.

items.question: Are network security controls (firewalls, cloud security groups, virtual firewalls) installed and configured at all network boundaries between the cardholder data environment (CDE) and untrusted networks, with a documented network diagram showing all connections (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 1.2.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Current network diagram showing CDE boundaries, all firewall/NSC placements, and connections to untrusted networks.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify network security controls at CDE boundaries (Req 1.2.1)

items.question: Is inbound and outbound traffic between the CDE and untrusted networks restricted to only that which is necessary for business purposes, with all other traffic explicitly denied by default (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 1.3.1, 1.3.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate traffic restriction rules at CDE boundaries (Req 1.3.1/1.3.2)

items.question: Are network security control rule sets reviewed at least every six months to confirm rules are still relevant, and are obsolete or unnecessary rules removed promptly (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 1.2.7)?
items.expectedEvidence: Firewall rule review records from the last two review cycles, showing date, reviewer, rules removed or modified, and approval sign-off.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review firewall rule set review cadence and evidence (Req 1.2.7)

items.question: Are vendor-supplied default accounts, passwords, and security parameters changed or disabled on all system components in the CDE before deployment to production, including default SNMP community strings, wireless encryption keys, and management console passwords (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 2.2.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify removal of default credentials on CDE systems (Req 2.2.2)

items.question: Are system configuration standards developed for all types of system components in the CDE, aligned with industry-accepted hardening standards (CIS, NIST, vendor guides), and applied consistently to all new and existing systems (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 2.2.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: System hardening standards documentation referencing CIS/NIST/vendor guides, compliance scan results showing adherence to standards.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review system hardening standards for CDE infrastructure (Req 2.2.1)

items.question: Are unnecessary services, protocols, daemons, and functions disabled or removed from all system components in the CDE, and is only required functionality enabled as documented in the configuration standards (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 2.2.4)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify minimal services configuration on CDE systems (Req 2.2.4)

items.question: Is anti-malware software deployed on all system components in the CDE that are commonly affected by malicious software, and are anti-malware solutions kept current with automatic updates, configured for periodic scans and real-time monitoring (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 5.2.1, 5.3.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify anti-malware deployment and updates on CDE systems (Req 5.2.1/5.3.1)

items.question: Are anti-malware mechanisms actively running and unable to be disabled or altered by users without explicit management authorization, with any disabling logged and time-limited (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 5.3.5)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm anti-malware tamper protection on CDE systems (Req 5.3.5)

items.question: Are phishing attack mechanisms addressed through anti-phishing controls, including email filtering, link analysis, and user awareness training for personnel with access to CDE infrastructure (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 5.4.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate anti-phishing controls for CDE personnel (Req 5.4.1)

items.question: Are security patches for all system components in the CDE installed within one month of release for critical patches and within a defined timeline for other severity levels, with a documented exception process for any delays (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 6.3.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Review patch management timeliness for CDE infrastructure (Req 6.3.3)

items.question: Is a process in place to identify and evaluate new security vulnerabilities affecting CDE infrastructure, using reputable vulnerability intelligence sources, and are vulnerabilities risk-ranked according to industry best practices (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 6.3.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify vulnerability identification process for CDE (Req 6.3.1)

items.question: Are audit trails enabled on all system components in the CDE to reconstruct individual user access to cardholder data, all actions taken by any individual with root or administrative privileges, all access to audit trails, all invalid logical access attempts, and use of identification and authentication mechanisms (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 10.2.1)?

items.question: Is an overall information security policy established, published, maintained, and disseminated to all relevant personnel and vendors, covering all PCI DSS requirements and reviewed at least annually (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 12.1.1)?

checklists.title: Network - ISO 27001:2022 Network Security

Covers A.8.20 (Network security), A.8.21 (Security of network services), A.8.22 (Segregation of networks), A.8.23 (Web filtering), A.8.24 (Use of cryptography), A.8.26 (Application security requirements), A.5.14 (Information transfer), secure remote access, wireless security, and network monitoring. checklists.title: Human - ISO 27001:2022 Personnel Security
checklists.description: Comprehensive personnel security checklist based on ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Annex A controls. checklists.title: DataAsset - GDPR Data Protection
checklists.description: Comprehensive GDPR data protection checklist for data assets covering all key regulation articles: data processing principles (Art. 5), lawful basis for processing (Art. 6), transparency and information obligations (Art. 13-14), data subject rights (Art. 15-22), data protection by design and by default (Art. 25), processor requirements (Art. 28), records of processing activities (Art. 30), security of processing (Art. 32), breach notification (Art. 33-34), data protection impact assessments (Art. 35), and international data transfers (Art. 44-49). This checklist ensures data assets are managed in full compliance with GDPR requirements.

items.question: Is personal data processed lawfully, fairly, and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject, with clear documentation of the lawful basis and purpose for each processing activity (Art. 5(1)(a))?
items.expectedEvidence: Records of processing activities showing the lawful basis, purpose specification, and transparency notices for each data processing activity.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify lawfulness, fairness, and transparency of data processing

items.question: Is the data asset subject to purpose limitation, ensuring personal data is collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner incompatible with those purposes (Art. 5(1)(b))?
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate purpose limitation compliance for data asset

items.question: Are data minimization, accuracy, and storage limitation principles applied to this data asset, ensuring only necessary data is collected, kept accurate, and retained no longer than required (Art. 5(1)(c-e))?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess data minimization, accuracy, and retention compliance

items.question: Has a valid lawful basis under Article 6 been identified and documented for each processing activity involving this data asset (consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interests, public task, or legitimate interests)?
items.expectedEvidence: Lawful basis assessment document for each processing activity, including legitimate interest assessments (LIA) where applicable.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document and validate lawful basis for all processing activities

items.question: Where legitimate interests is relied upon as the lawful basis, has a legitimate interests assessment (LIA) been conducted and documented, balancing organizational needs against data subject rights (Art. 6(1)(f))?
items.expectedEvidence: Completed legitimate interests assessment documenting the purpose, necessity, and balancing test against data subject rights and freedoms.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review legitimate interests assessments for applicable processing activities

items.question: Are data subjects provided with all required information at the time of data collection, including controller identity, processing purposes, lawful basis, recipients, retention periods, and their rights (Art. 13)?
items.expectedEvidence: Privacy notices, data collection forms, and consent screens showing all required Art. 13 information elements in clear and plain language.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify completeness of Art. 13 transparency information

items.question: Where personal data is not obtained directly from the data subject, is the required information provided within a reasonable period and no later than one month (Art. 14)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate Art. 14 notification for indirectly collected data

items.question: Is there a documented and tested process to handle data subject access requests (DSAR), enabling the organization to provide a copy of all personal data being processed within the required timeframe (Art. 15)?
items.expectedEvidence: DSAR handling procedure, system capability to extract all personal data related to a data subject, and sample completed DSAR responses.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review and test data subject access request handling process

items.question: Can the organization fulfill the right to rectification by correcting inaccurate personal data and completing incomplete data without undue delay (Art. 16)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify capability to rectify personal data upon request

items.question: Is the organization able to erase personal data without undue delay when required (right to be forgotten), including propagation of erasure requests to processors and third parties (Art. 17)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess right to erasure implementation and propagation capability

items.question: Can data subjects exercise the right to data portability, receiving their personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format, and can it be transmitted directly to another controller where technically feasible (Art. 20)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate data portability capability and export format compliance

items.question: Has data protection by design been implemented for this data asset, incorporating appropriate technical and organizational measures (pseudonymization, encryption, access controls) from the initial design stage (Art. 25(1))?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess data protection by design measures for the data asset

items.question: Is data protection by default ensured, so that only personal data necessary for each specific purpose is processed, considering the amount collected, extent of processing, storage period, and accessibility (Art. 25(2))?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify data protection by default configuration for the data asset

items.question: Where personal data is processed by a third-party processor, is there a written contract or legal act in place that stipulates the subject matter, duration, nature, and purpose of processing, as well as the obligations of the processor (Art. 28)?
items.expectedEvidence: Data processing agreements (DPA) with all processors, including mandatory Art. 28(3) clauses covering instructions, confidentiality, security, sub-processing, assistance, and deletion/return obligations.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review data processing agreements with all third-party processors

items.question: Is a record of processing activities (ROPA) maintained for this data asset that includes all required information such as purposes, data categories, recipients, transfers, retention periods, and security measures (Art. 30)?
items.expectedEvidence: Record of processing activities (ROPA) entry for this data asset with all Art. 30(1) required fields completed and dated.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate records of processing activities for the data asset

items.question: Are appropriate technical and organizational security measures implemented for this data asset, including encryption, pseudonymization, resilience of systems, backup and recovery capabilities, and regular testing (Art. 32)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess security of processing measures for the data asset

items.question: Is there a documented incident response plan specific to personal data breaches involving this data asset, including procedures for supervisory authority notification within 72 hours and data subject notification where required (Art. 33-34)?
items.expectedEvidence: Breach response plan covering detection, assessment, authority notification within 72 hours, data subject notification criteria, and post-incident review procedures.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review personal data breach notification procedures for the data asset

items.question: Has the breach notification process been tested through tabletop exercises or simulations to ensure readiness and ability to meet the 72-hour notification deadline (Art. 33)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify breach notification process testing and readiness

items.question: Has a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) been conducted for processing activities involving this data asset that are likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of individuals (Art. 35)?
items.expectedEvidence: Completed DPIA document including systematic description of processing, necessity and proportionality assessment, risk assessment, and mitigation measures.
items.autoTaskTitle: Conduct or review Data Protection Impact Assessment for the data asset

items.question: Where personal data from this data asset is transferred to third countries or international organizations, are appropriate safeguards in place such as adequacy decisions, standard contractual clauses, or binding corporate rules (Art. 44-49)?
items.expectedEvidence: Transfer impact assessments, executed standard contractual clauses (SCCs), adequacy decision references, or binding corporate rules documentation for all international data transfers.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate international data transfer safeguards for the data asset

items.question: Has a Transfer Impact Assessment (TIA) been performed to evaluate whether the legal framework of the recipient country provides adequate protection, and have supplementary measures been implemented where necessary (Schrems II compliance)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess transfer impact and supplementary measures for cross-border data flows

checklists.title: DataAsset - PCI DSS v4.0 Cardholder Data
checklists.description: Comprehensive PCI DSS v4.0 compliance checklist for cardholder data assets. Covers Requirement 3 (Protect Stored Account Data), Requirement 4 (Protect Cardholder Data with Strong Cryptography During Transmission), Requirement 7 (Restrict Access to System Components and Cardholder Data by Business Need to Know), Requirement 8 (Identify Users and Authenticate Access), Requirement 9 (Restrict Physical Access to Cardholder Data), as well as data discovery, tokenization, masking, and cryptographic key management controls. This checklist ensures cardholder data assets meet PCI DSS v4.0 security requirements.

items.question: Are processes and mechanisms defined and documented for protecting stored account data, including a data retention and disposal policy that limits storage amount and retention time to what is required for business, legal, and regulatory purposes (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.1)?
items.expectedEvidence: Data retention and disposal policy, documented storage justification, and evidence of quarterly reviews to purge data exceeding retention requirements.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review data retention and disposal policy for cardholder data

items.question: Is stored sensitive authentication data (SAD) not retained after authorization, even if encrypted, and are processes in place to securely delete SAD immediately after authorization completes (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify sensitive authentication data is not retained post-authorization

items.question: Is the primary account number (PAN) rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored using strong cryptography, one-way hashes, truncation, or index tokens with securely stored pads (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.5)?
items.expectedEvidence: Technical documentation of PAN protection methods in use, encryption algorithm details, and evidence of unreadability verification across all storage locations.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate PAN is rendered unreadable in all storage locations

items.question: Are cryptographic keys used to protect stored account data managed with appropriate key management processes, including generation, distribution, storage, rotation, and destruction (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.6)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess cryptographic key management processes for stored cardholder data

items.question: Is strong cryptography used to protect cardholder data during transmission over open, public networks, including the use of trusted keys and certificates, secure protocol versions, and proper cipher configurations (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 4.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Network diagrams showing encryption points, TLS configuration details, certificate inventory, and scan results confirming no weak protocols or ciphers.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify strong cryptography for cardholder data in transit

items.question: Is PAN secured with strong cryptography whenever it is sent via end-user messaging technologies such as email, instant messaging, SMS, or chat (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 4.2.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify PAN encryption in end-user messaging technologies

items.question: Is access to system components and cardholder data restricted to only those individuals whose job function requires such access, with access rights assigned based on the principle of least privilege (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 7.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess least-privilege access controls for cardholder data

items.question: Is an access control model defined that includes an authorization process for granting access, automatic revocation of terminated user accounts, and periodic review of access rights (at least every six months) (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 7.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Access control policy, user access review reports from the last two review cycles, and evidence of timely revocation for terminated personnel.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review access control model and periodic access review results

items.question: Are all users assigned a unique identification before allowing access to system components or cardholder data, and are shared, group, or generic accounts prohibited except where specifically allowed and documented (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 8.2)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify unique user identification and prohibition of shared accounts

items.question: Is multi-factor authentication (MFA) implemented for all access into the cardholder data environment (CDE) from outside the network, and for all non-console administrative access to CDE systems (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 8.4)?
items.expectedEvidence: MFA configuration evidence for remote and administrative CDE access, list of CDE access points, and MFA technology documentation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate multi-factor authentication for CDE access

items.question: Are strong authentication factors used, including passwords of minimum 12 characters (or 8 if the system does not support 12) containing both numeric and alphabetic characters, and are passwords changed at least every 90 days (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 8.3)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess password complexity and rotation requirements compliance

items.question: Are physical access controls in place to restrict access to systems and media containing cardholder data, including visitor management, badge systems, and monitoring of sensitive areas (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 9.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Physical access control documentation, visitor logs, badge access records, and CCTV monitoring evidence for cardholder data storage areas.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify physical access controls for cardholder data areas

items.question: Are all media containing cardholder data physically secured, classified, and destroyed when no longer needed using industry-accepted methods (cross-cut shredding, incineration, or pulping for hard copy; cryptographic erasure or degaussing for electronic media) (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 9.4)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify media security, classification, and destruction procedures

items.question: Is a cardholder data discovery process in place that runs at least every six months and upon significant changes to identify all locations where PAN is stored, ensuring no unintended or unknown storage exists (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 12.10)?
items.expectedEvidence: Data discovery scan reports, list of confirmed PAN storage locations, remediation actions for unauthorized storage, and scan schedule documentation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review cardholder data discovery scan results and remediation

items.question: Is there an up-to-date data flow diagram that documents all cardholder data flows across systems, networks, and applications, including flows to and from third-party service providers (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 1.2)?
items.expectedEvidence: Current cardholder data flow diagrams showing all CDE boundaries, data entry and exit points, and third-party connections.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate cardholder data flow diagrams are current and complete

items.question: Where tokenization is used to protect cardholder data, are the tokenization systems and processes validated to ensure tokens cannot be reversed to recover the original PAN, and are token vaults adequately secured (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.5)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess tokenization implementation security and irreversibility

items.question: Is PAN masked when displayed such that only personnel with a documented business need can see more than the first six and last four digits, and are display masking rules enforced at the application level (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.4)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify PAN masking rules enforcement in all display contexts

items.question: Are cryptographic key management procedures documented and implemented that include key generation using strong random sources, secure key distribution, protected key storage, defined cryptoperiods, and secure key retirement and destruction (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.7)?
items.expectedEvidence: Key management procedure document, key inventory, cryptoperiod schedule, key custodian acknowledgment forms, and evidence of secure key storage mechanisms (HSM, split knowledge).
items.autoTaskTitle: Review cryptographic key management procedures and compliance

items.question: Are encryption keys rotated at the end of their defined cryptoperiod, and is there a process for retiring or replacing keys when they are suspected of being compromised, weakened, or when the cryptoperiod expires (PCI DSS v4.0 Req 3.7)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess encryption key rotation and replacement processes

checklists.title: DataAsset - ISO 27001:2022 Information Classification
checklists.description: Information classification and data security checklist based on ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Annex A controls. Covers asset inventory (A.5.9), acceptable use of information (A.5.10), information classification (A.5.12), labelling of information (A.5.13), information transfer (A.5.14), user endpoint devices (A.8.1), information deletion (A.8.10), data masking (A.8.11), data leakage prevention (A.8.12), and use of cryptography (A.8.24). This checklist ensures data assets are classified, labelled, handled, and protected in accordance with the latest ISO 27001:2022 standard.

items.question: Is a complete and accurate inventory of information assets maintained for this data asset, including its owner, custodian, classification level, location, and associated systems, with the inventory reviewed at planned intervals (A.5.9)?
items.expectedEvidence: Asset inventory record for this data asset showing owner, custodian, classification, storage location, associated systems, and last review date.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate data asset inventory completeness and accuracy

items.question: Is the data asset owner clearly identified and accountable for the lifecycle management of the asset, including classification, access decisions, and periodic review (A.5.9)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify data asset ownership assignment and accountability

items.question: Are rules for the acceptable use of this data asset identified, documented, and communicated to all personnel and relevant external parties who access or process the information (A.5.10)?
items.expectedEvidence: Acceptable use policy referencing this data asset category, signed acknowledgment records from users, and communication evidence.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review acceptable use rules for the data asset

items.question: Has this data asset been classified according to the organization information classification scheme, considering legal requirements, value, criticality, and sensitivity to unauthorized disclosure or modification (A.5.12)?
items.expectedEvidence: Classification record for the data asset showing the assigned classification level, rationale, classification date, and the authorized classifier.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify data asset classification in accordance with the classification scheme

items.question: Is the classification level of this data asset reviewed periodically or when significant changes occur (such as changes in sensitivity, regulatory requirements, or business context) to ensure it remains appropriate (A.5.12)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Schedule periodic classification review for the data asset

items.question: Is this data asset appropriately labelled in accordance with the classification scheme, including physical labels on media, metadata tags in electronic systems, and visual markings on documents (A.5.13)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess information labelling implementation for the data asset

items.question: Is there an automated or systematic process to ensure labelling is consistently applied and maintained when data is copied, moved, or transformed across systems and storage locations (A.5.13)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify persistent labelling across data transformation and transfer

items.question: Are rules, procedures, and agreements in place for the secure transfer of this data asset, addressing the protection requirements based on the classification level during transfer by all means (electronic, physical, verbal) (A.5.14)?
items.expectedEvidence: Information transfer policy, secure transfer procedure documentation, approved transfer channels, and sample transfer agreements with external parties.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review information transfer controls for the data asset

items.question: Are secure transfer mechanisms verified and enforced for this data asset, including encryption in transit, integrity verification, non-repudiation controls, and chain-of-custody tracking where appropriate (A.5.14)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess secure transfer mechanism enforcement for the data asset

items.question: Are security controls enforced on user endpoint devices that access this data asset, including encryption, endpoint detection and response (EDR), screen lock, and remote wipe capabilities (A.8.1)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate endpoint device security controls for data asset access

items.question: Are procedures in place for the secure deletion of this data asset when it is no longer required, ensuring that information stored in systems, devices, and media is irrecoverably removed or overwritten (A.8.10)?
items.expectedEvidence: Data deletion procedure, deletion certification records, and evidence of secure erasure methods (cryptographic erase, overwrite, physical destruction) used for this data asset.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify secure deletion procedures and records for the data asset

items.question: Does the deletion process account for all copies and backups of this data asset, including replicas in cloud environments, disaster recovery sites, and offline archives (A.8.10)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate deletion coverage across all data asset copies and backups

items.question: Is data masking applied to this data asset in accordance with the access control policy and business requirements, ensuring that sensitive information is obscured when full access is not required (A.8.11)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess data masking implementation for the data asset

items.question: Are data masking techniques (pseudonymization, anonymization, redaction, tokenization) applied consistently in non-production environments such as development, testing, and training (A.8.11)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify data masking in non-production environments

items.question: Are data leakage prevention (DLP) measures applied to this data asset to detect and prevent the unauthorized disclosure or extraction of sensitive information through channels such as email, web, removable media, and cloud services (A.8.12)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate DLP controls for the data asset

items.question: Are DLP policies configured to detect patterns specific to the classification level and data type of this asset, and are DLP alerts monitored, investigated, and responded to in a timely manner (A.8.12)?
items.expectedEvidence: DLP policy configuration documentation, alert monitoring procedures, sample incident reports triggered by DLP, and response time metrics.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review DLP policy configuration and alert response for the data asset

items.question: Are cryptographic controls implemented for this data asset in accordance with the organization cryptographic policy, including appropriate algorithm selection, key lengths, and protocol usage for data at rest and in transit (A.8.24)?
items.expectedEvidence: Cryptographic controls inventory for this data asset showing algorithms, key lengths, protocols, certificate details, and compliance with the organizational cryptographic policy.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate cryptographic controls implementation for the data asset

checklists.title: AISystem - EU AI Act Compliance
checklists.description: Comprehensive compliance checklist aligned with the EU Artificial Intelligence Act (Regulation (EU) 2024/1689) for AI system assessments. Covers risk classification (Art. 6), risk management systems (Art. 9), data and data governance (Art. 10), technical documentation (Art. 11), record-keeping and logging (Art. 12), transparency and information to deployers (Art. 13), human oversight (Art. 14), accuracy, robustness, and cybersecurity (Art. 15), provider obligations (Art. 16-17), deployer obligations (Art. 26), transparency obligations for certain AI systems (Art. 50), general-purpose AI models (Art. 52), foundation model requirements, and prohibited AI practices (Art. 5). This checklist ensures AI systems comply with EU AI Act requirements based on their risk classification.

items.question: Has the AI system been evaluated against the list of prohibited AI practices, confirming it does not engage in subliminal manipulation, exploitation of vulnerabilities, social scoring by public authorities, or real-time remote biometric identification in publicly accessible spaces except where permitted (Art. 5)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm AI system does not engage in prohibited practices

items.question: Has the AI system been properly classified according to the risk-based framework (unacceptable, high-risk, limited risk, or minimal risk), considering its intended purpose, deployment context, and the Annex III categories of high-risk AI systems (Art. 6)?
items.expectedEvidence: Risk classification assessment document showing the analysis methodology, applicable Annex III categories, and final risk classification determination.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document AI system risk classification under EU AI Act

items.question: Is a risk management system established, implemented, documented, and maintained for the AI system throughout its entire lifecycle, including identification and analysis of known and reasonably foreseeable risks (Art. 9)?
items.expectedEvidence: Risk management system documentation including risk identification methodology, risk analysis results, risk evaluation criteria, and risk treatment measures.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review AI risk management system and lifecycle coverage

items.question: Are appropriate risk management measures adopted for the AI system, including elimination or reduction of risks through design and development, and are residual risks communicated to deployers (Art. 9)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess risk management measures and residual risk communication

items.question: Are data governance and management practices established for training, validation, and testing data sets, including data quality criteria, bias examination, data collection processes, and data preparation operations (Art. 10)?
items.expectedEvidence: Data governance framework, data quality assessment reports, bias examination methodology and results, and data processing documentation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review data governance and management practices for AI system

items.question: Are training, validation, and testing data sets relevant, sufficiently representative, and free from errors to the best extent possible, with consideration given to the specific geographical, contextual, behavioral, or functional setting of the AI system (Art. 10)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate training data representativeness and quality

items.question: Is technical documentation drawn up before the AI system is placed on the market or put into service, and is it kept up to date, demonstrating compliance with the requirements of the EU AI Act (Art. 11)?
items.expectedEvidence: Technical documentation package as specified in Annex IV, including general description, development process, monitoring and functioning, and risk management documentation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify technical documentation completeness per Annex IV

items.question: Is the AI system designed and developed with capabilities to automatically record events (logs) throughout its lifetime, ensuring traceability of system functioning, including logging of periods of use, reference databases, input data, and identification of persons involved in verification of results (Art. 12)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify automatic record-keeping and logging capabilities of AI system

items.question: Is the AI system designed and developed to ensure sufficient transparency to enable deployers to interpret the system output and use it appropriately, with clear instructions for use provided (Art. 13)?
items.expectedEvidence: Instructions for use documentation including system capabilities and limitations, intended purpose, accuracy levels, known risks, and human oversight measures.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review AI system transparency and instructions for use

items.question: Is the AI system designed and developed to be effectively overseen by natural persons during the period of use, including appropriate human-machine interface tools enabling individuals to understand, monitor, and intervene in the system operation (Art. 14)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess human oversight capabilities and intervention mechanisms

items.question: Can authorized human overseers effectively override, interrupt, or stop the AI system when necessary, and are they able to decide not to use the system or disregard its output in any particular situation (Art. 14)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Confirm human override and stop capabilities for AI system

items.question: Is the AI system designed and developed to achieve an appropriate level of accuracy, robustness, and cybersecurity, and does it perform consistently throughout its lifecycle (Art. 15)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Evaluate AI system accuracy, robustness, and cybersecurity levels

items.question: Is the AI system resilient against attempts by unauthorized third parties to alter its use, outputs, or performance by exploiting system vulnerabilities, including adversarial attacks (Art. 15)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify AI system resilience against adversarial attacks

items.question: Has the provider ensured compliance with all provider obligations including the quality management system, conformity assessment, CE marking, EU declaration of conformity, registration, and post-market monitoring system (Art. 16-17)?
items.expectedEvidence: Quality management system documentation, conformity assessment records, CE declaration, EU database registration confirmation, and post-market monitoring plan.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify provider obligations compliance and documentation

items.question: Has the deployer implemented appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure use of the AI system in accordance with its instructions for use, including monitoring of system operation and informing the provider of any serious incidents or malfunctions (Art. 26)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess deployer obligation compliance and operational monitoring

items.question: Where applicable, are users informed that they are interacting with an AI system (e.g., chatbots, deepfake detection), and is AI-generated or manipulated content clearly labeled as such (Art. 50)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify user notification and content labeling for AI-generated outputs

items.question: If the AI system is based on a general-purpose AI model, has the provider of the general-purpose AI model complied with obligations regarding technical documentation, information to downstream providers, copyright compliance, and training data summarization (Art. 52)?
items.expectedEvidence: General-purpose AI model technical documentation, downstream provider information packages, copyright compliance evidence, and training data summary.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review general-purpose AI model compliance documentation

items.question: If the AI system uses a foundation model with systemic risk, have additional obligations been met including model evaluation, adversarial testing, tracking and reporting of serious incidents, and ensuring adequate cybersecurity protections (Art. 55)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess foundation model systemic risk obligations compliance

items.question: Has a fundamental rights impact assessment been performed for high-risk AI systems used by deployers that are bodies governed by public law or private entities providing public services, documenting potential impacts on affected persons (Art. 27)?
items.expectedEvidence: Fundamental rights impact assessment document, stakeholder consultation records, and mitigation measures for identified impacts.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review fundamental rights impact assessment for AI system

checklists.title: Tool - ISO 27001:2022 Security Tooling
checklists.description: Security checklist based on ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Annex A controls relevant to security tooling. Covers A.5.7 (Threat intelligence), A.5.23 (Information security for use of cloud services), A.8.7 (Protection against malware), A.8.8 (Management of technical vulnerabilities), A.8.15 (Logging), A.8.16 (Monitoring activities), tool inventory management, tool hardening, tool access control, tool patching, and tool integration security. This checklist ensures security tools are themselves properly secured and managed according to ISO 27001:2022 standards.

items.question: Are threat intelligence tools deployed and configured to collect, analyze, and disseminate information about threats relevant to the organization, including integration with external threat feeds and internal telemetry sources (A.5.7)?
items.expectedEvidence: Threat intelligence platform configuration, subscribed feed inventory, sample threat reports, and evidence of dissemination to security operations teams.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate threat intelligence tool deployment and feed integration

items.question: Is threat intelligence produced by security tools actionable and contextualised, providing relevance scores, affected assets, and recommended response actions to reduce analyst decision time (A.5.7)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess actionability and context quality of threat intelligence output

items.question: Are cloud-based security tools (SaaS SIEM, cloud CASB, cloud-hosted vulnerability scanners) assessed for information security risks before adoption, with data residency, encryption, and access control requirements documented and verified (A.5.23)?
items.expectedEvidence: Cloud security tool risk assessment reports, vendor security questionnaire responses, and contractual clauses addressing data residency and encryption.
items.autoTaskTitle: Review cloud-based security tool risk assessments

items.question: Are anti-malware and endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools deployed across all supported endpoints and servers, with real-time protection enabled, signatures updated automatically, and cloud-based behavioral analysis active (A.8.7)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify anti-malware and EDR deployment coverage and update status

items.question: Are malware detection tools configured to alert, quarantine, and report on detected threats, with automated escalation to the security operations team for threats above a defined severity threshold (A.8.7)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify malware detection alerting and escalation configuration

items.question: Are vulnerability management tools deployed to identify technical vulnerabilities across the environment, with scan coverage validated to ensure all in-scope assets are scanned at the required frequency (A.8.8)?
items.expectedEvidence: Vulnerability scanner deployment map, asset coverage report showing percentage of in-scope assets scanned, and scan frequency configuration.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate vulnerability management tool coverage and scan frequency

items.question: Do vulnerability management tools integrate with the patch management process and ticketing systems to enable tracked, prioritized remediation workflows with SLA-based timelines (A.8.8)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess vulnerability-to-remediation workflow integration

items.question: Are logging tools configured to produce, store, and protect logs that record activities, exceptions, faults, and information security events, with log integrity mechanisms such as write-once storage or cryptographic chaining (A.8.15)?
items.expectedEvidence: Log management architecture, log integrity verification mechanisms, retention configuration, and sample audit demonstrating tamper-evident log storage.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate logging tool configuration and log integrity protections

items.question: Are monitoring tools configured to detect anomalous behavior and potential security incidents, with detection rules tuned to the organization threat profile and false positive rates tracked and minimized (A.8.16)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess monitoring tool detection effectiveness and tuning

items.question: Is a complete and accurate inventory of all security tools maintained, including tool name, version, vendor, license expiration, owner, purpose, and integration dependencies?
items.expectedEvidence: Security tool inventory spreadsheet or CMDB export showing all deployed security tools with version, owner, license status, and last-reviewed date.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify security tool inventory completeness and accuracy

items.question: Are security tools themselves hardened according to vendor and industry best practices, including disabling unnecessary features, restricting network exposure, and applying security-specific configurations?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify security tool hardening against vendor best practices

items.question: Is access to security tools restricted using the principle of least privilege, with role-based access control, multi-factor authentication for administrative access, and regular access reviews conducted at least quarterly?
items.expectedEvidence: RBAC configuration for security tools, MFA enforcement evidence, and quarterly access review records with remediation actions taken.
items.autoTaskTitle: Validate access control and MFA enforcement on security tools

items.question: Are security tools included in the organization patch management program, with critical patches applied within defined SLAs and tool updates tested in a staging environment before production deployment?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify security tool patching process and SLA compliance

items.question: Are integrations between security tools secured with encrypted communication channels, API authentication (API keys, OAuth tokens, certificates), and least-privilege service accounts with audit logging enabled on all integration points?
items.autoTaskTitle: Assess security of inter-tool integrations and API authentication

items.question: Is a formal decommissioning process defined for security tools that are being retired or replaced, ensuring data migration, log preservation, access revocation, and secure disposal of tool infrastructure (A.8.10)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify security tool decommissioning and secure disposal process

checklists.title: Backup & Disaster Recovery
checklists.description: Comprehensive checklist for backup strategies, disaster recovery planning, and business continuity assurance. Covers the 3-2-1 backup rule, recovery testing, immutable backups, ransomware resilience, and organizational readiness for disruptive events aligned with ISO 22301 and NIST SP 800-34.

items.question: Is the 3-2-1 backup rule implemented: at least 3 copies of data, on 2 different media types, with 1 copy stored offsite or in a separate cloud region?
items.expectedEvidence: Backup architecture diagram showing three copies across different media/locations, backup job configurations, and storage inventory documenting media diversity.
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement 3-2-1 backup strategy across all critical systems

items.question: Are all backup data encrypted at rest using strong encryption (AES-256 or equivalent), with encryption keys managed separately from the backup data and rotated on a defined schedule?
items.autoTaskTitle: Enable AES-256 encryption for all backup data at rest

items.question: Are backup restoration tests conducted at least quarterly, with documented results verifying data integrity, completeness, and restoration within defined RTO targets?
items.expectedEvidence: Quarterly restoration test reports with timestamps, restored data integrity checksums, measured restoration times vs. RTO targets, and identified gaps with remediation actions.
items.autoTaskTitle: Conduct quarterly backup restoration tests and document results

items.question: Are offsite or cloud-based backups configured for all critical systems, stored in a geographically separate location from primary data, with network connectivity independent from the primary site?
items.autoTaskTitle: Configure geographically separated offsite backups for critical systems

items.question: Are Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO) formally defined for all critical systems and data assets, approved by business stakeholders, and aligned with SLA commitments?
items.expectedEvidence: RTO/RPO matrix per system tier, business stakeholder sign-off, SLA mapping documentation, and evidence that backup schedules align with defined RPOs.
items.autoTaskTitle: Define and document RTO/RPO for all critical systems

items.question: Is a comprehensive Disaster Recovery Plan documented, covering system recovery procedures, team roles and responsibilities, escalation paths, and dependencies between systems?
items.expectedEvidence: DR plan document with version control, recovery procedure runbooks, RACI matrix, system dependency maps, and evidence of annual review and approval.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document comprehensive disaster recovery plan

items.question: Are failover tests (e.g., regional failover, database failover, load balancer failover) performed at least annually, with documented results and identified improvements?
items.autoTaskTitle: Conduct annual failover testing for critical systems

items.question: Are immutable backups implemented (e.g., AWS S3 Object Lock, Azure Immutable Blob Storage, WORM storage) to prevent backup deletion or modification by malicious actors or ransomware?
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement immutable backup storage with WORM protection

items.question: Is automated monitoring in place for backup job status, with alerts for failed, missed, or incomplete backups, and a dashboard providing visibility into backup health across all systems?
items.autoTaskTitle: Deploy automated backup monitoring and alerting

items.question: Is the backup infrastructure hardened against ransomware through network segmentation, air-gapped backups, separate authentication domains for backup systems, and backup integrity validation?
items.autoTaskTitle: Harden backup infrastructure against ransomware attacks

items.question: Are access controls for backup systems strictly limited, with separate privileged accounts, MFA enforcement, and audit logging of all backup administration activities?
items.autoTaskTitle: Enforce strict access controls on backup systems

items.question: Has a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) been conducted to identify critical business processes, their dependencies, maximum tolerable downtime, and the financial impact of disruption?
items.expectedEvidence: BIA report identifying critical processes, dependency mapping, maximum tolerable downtime per process, financial impact quantification, and executive approval.
items.autoTaskTitle: Conduct Business Impact Analysis for all critical processes

items.question: Is a crisis communication plan documented and tested, defining notification procedures for stakeholders, customers, regulators, and media during a disaster or major incident?
items.autoTaskTitle: Document and test crisis communication plan

items.question: Are detailed, step-by-step recovery runbooks maintained for each critical system, including prerequisites, recovery commands, validation steps, and rollback procedures?
items.expectedEvidence: Sample recovery runbooks with step-by-step instructions, version control history, evidence of runbook review during restoration tests, and team accessibility verification.
items.autoTaskTitle: Create and maintain recovery runbooks for all critical systems

items.question: Is geographic redundancy implemented for Tier-1 critical systems, with active-active or active-passive configurations across regions separated by sufficient distance to mitigate regional disasters?
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement geographic redundancy for Tier-1 critical systems

items.question: Is a backup retention policy defined and enforced, specifying retention periods per data classification (e.g., 30 days operational, 1 year regulatory, 7 years legal), with automated lifecycle management?
items.autoTaskTitle: Define and enforce backup retention policy per data classification

items.question: Is the disaster recovery team identified, trained, and rehearsed, with clear roles, contact information, and alternates defined, and at least annual training conducted?
items.autoTaskTitle: Train and rehearse disaster recovery team annually

items.question: Are backup and recovery practices compliant with applicable regulatory requirements (GDPR data protection, HIPAA safeguards, PCI DSS requirement 9.5), with evidence of compliance documented?
items.expectedEvidence: Regulatory compliance mapping for backup practices, audit findings, data residency documentation for backup storage locations, and data protection impact assessments.
items.autoTaskTitle: Verify backup practices comply with regulatory requirements

checklists.title: Security Documentation & Policy Management
checklists.description: Comprehensive checklist for security policy documentation, governance frameworks, and document lifecycle management. Covers all essential security policies, procedures, and guidelines required by ISO 27001:2022 and ensures proper version control, review cycles, and organizational awareness.

items.question: Is a top-level Information Security Policy documented, approved by executive management, communicated to all employees, and reviewed at least annually or after significant changes?
items.expectedEvidence: Information Security Policy document with executive approval signatures, version history, distribution records, and evidence of annual review.
items.autoTaskTitle: Establish and maintain Information Security Policy with executive approval

items.question: Is an Acceptable Use Policy in place covering the proper use of IT assets, internet, email, social media, BYOD, and remote work, with acknowledgment required from all users?
items.expectedEvidence: Acceptable Use Policy document, user acknowledgment records (signed or electronic), and evidence of inclusion in onboarding process.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document Acceptable Use Policy and collect user acknowledgments

items.question: Is a data classification scheme defined (e.g., Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted) with clear handling requirements, labeling standards, and examples for each classification level?
items.autoTaskTitle: Define data classification scheme with handling requirements

items.question: Is an Access Control Policy documented covering user provisioning, de-provisioning, access reviews, privilege management, and the principle of least privilege across all systems?
items.autoTaskTitle: Document Access Control Policy with provisioning and review procedures

items.question: Is an Incident Response Plan documented, covering detection, triage, containment, eradication, recovery, and post-incident review phases, with defined roles and escalation procedures?
items.expectedEvidence: Incident Response Plan document with phase descriptions, RACI matrix, escalation flowcharts, communication templates, and evidence of tabletop exercises.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document Incident Response Plan with escalation procedures

items.question: Are Business Continuity Plans (BCP) and Disaster Recovery Plans (DRP) documented for all critical business processes, with dependencies mapped and recovery strategies defined?
items.expectedEvidence: BCP and DRP documents with scope definitions, recovery strategies, resource requirements, testing schedules, and evidence of management approval.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Plans

items.question: Is a Change Management Procedure documented covering change request, impact assessment, approval workflow, implementation planning, rollback procedures, and post-implementation review?
items.autoTaskTitle: Document change management procedure with approval workflows

items.question: Is a Vendor/Supplier Security Management Policy in place covering security requirements in contracts, due diligence assessments, ongoing monitoring, and incident notification obligations?
items.autoTaskTitle: Document vendor security management policy and assessment procedures

items.question: Is a Data Protection/Privacy Policy documented covering personal data handling, lawful processing bases, data subject rights procedures, retention schedules, and cross-border transfer mechanisms?
items.expectedEvidence: Data Protection Policy document, data processing records (ROPA), DPIA templates, data subject request procedures, and evidence of DPO appointment if required.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document Data Protection Policy with GDPR/privacy compliance

items.question: Is a Cryptography Policy documented specifying approved algorithms, key lengths, key management procedures, certificate standards, and the use of encryption for data at rest and in transit?
items.autoTaskTitle: Document cryptography policy with approved algorithms and key management

items.question: Is a Physical Security Policy documented covering facility access controls, visitor management, equipment protection, secure disposal, and environmental controls (fire, flood, power)?
items.autoTaskTitle: Document physical security policy with access and environmental controls

items.question: Is a Security Awareness and Training Policy documented, mandating initial and annual security training for all employees, role-based training for IT/security staff, and phishing simulation exercises?
items.autoTaskTitle: Document security awareness and training policy

items.question: Are all security documents maintained under version control with a document management system, including version numbers, change logs, approval workflows, and access-controlled distribution?
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement version control for all security documentation

items.question: Are all security policies and procedures reviewed on a defined cadence (at least annually), with reviews triggered by significant organizational changes, incidents, or regulatory updates?
items.autoTaskTitle: Establish annual review cadence for all security documentation

items.question: Are Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) and confidentiality obligations tracked for all employees, contractors, and third parties with access to sensitive information, with renewal and termination procedures in place?
items.expectedEvidence: NDA tracking register with status, expiration dates, and signatory information. Evidence of NDA inclusion in onboarding/offboarding checklists and contractor management processes.
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement NDA tracking register with lifecycle management

checklists.title: Security Reporting & Metrics
checklists.description: Comprehensive checklist for security reporting, metrics tracking, and executive communication. Covers KPI definition, dashboard creation, vulnerability management reporting, compliance audits, and board-level security communication aligned with ISO 27001:2022 measurement requirements and NIST Cybersecurity Framework.

items.question: Are security Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) defined, measured, and tracked regularly, covering metrics such as mean time to detect (MTTD), mean time to respond (MTTR), patch compliance rate, and vulnerability density?
items.expectedEvidence: KPI definition document with targets, measurement methodology, data sources, and trending reports showing KPI performance over at least 6 months.
items.autoTaskTitle: Define and track security KPIs with measurement methodology

items.question: Is an executive security dashboard maintained providing real-time or near-real-time visibility into overall security posture, open risks, incident status, and compliance metrics in a business-consumable format?
items.expectedEvidence: Screenshots of executive dashboard, data sources feeding the dashboard, refresh frequency, and evidence of executive stakeholder feedback on dashboard utility.
items.autoTaskTitle: Build executive security dashboard with real-time metrics

items.question: Are vulnerability management reports generated regularly with SLA compliance tracking (e.g., Critical: 24h, High: 7d, Medium: 30d, Low: 90d), aging analysis, and remediation trend data?
items.autoTaskTitle: Generate vulnerability reports with SLA compliance tracking

items.question: Are monthly security posture reports produced summarizing new vulnerabilities, incident activity, risk changes, compliance status, and key actions taken, distributed to security leadership and stakeholders?
items.autoTaskTitle: Produce monthly security posture reports for stakeholders

items.question: Are compliance audit reports (internal and external) documented with findings, risk ratings, remediation plans, and tracked to closure, with management review of audit results?
items.expectedEvidence: Recent internal/external audit reports, finding remediation tracker, management review minutes, and evidence of corrective action implementation.
items.autoTaskTitle: Document compliance audit findings and track remediation

items.question: Are post-incident reports produced for all significant security incidents, including timeline, root cause analysis (RCA), impact assessment, containment actions, and preventive measures?
items.autoTaskTitle: Produce post-incident reports with root cause analysis

items.question: Is trend analysis performed on security metrics (incident volume, vulnerability counts, compliance scores, risk register changes) to identify patterns, predict emerging risks, and measure program effectiveness over time?
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement security metrics trend analysis and forecasting

items.question: Is a risk heatmap maintained and regularly updated, visualizing the organization's risk landscape across business units, systems, and threat categories, with risk appetite thresholds clearly defined?
items.expectedEvidence: Current risk heatmap visualization, risk appetite statement, risk register extract, and evidence of quarterly risk review meetings with heatmap updates.
items.autoTaskTitle: Create and maintain security risk heatmap with appetite thresholds

items.question: Is a centralized remediation tracking system in place for security findings from all sources (audits, penetration tests, vulnerability scans, incidents), with progress reporting and escalation for overdue items?
items.autoTaskTitle: Implement centralized security remediation tracking system

items.question: Are board-level security reports prepared quarterly (or as required), presenting security posture in business risk terms, with comparisons to industry benchmarks, regulatory compliance status, and investment recommendations?
items.autoTaskTitle: Prepare quarterly board-level security reports

items.question: Is the organization's security posture benchmarked against industry peers, recognized frameworks (CIS Benchmarks, NIST CSF maturity), or sector-specific standards to identify relative strengths and gaps?
items.autoTaskTitle: Conduct security posture benchmarking against industry standards

items.question: Are regular threat landscape reports produced or consumed (e.g., monthly threat briefings, threat intelligence summaries) to keep stakeholders informed of emerging threats relevant to the organization's industry and technology stack?
items.autoTaskTitle: Produce regular threat landscape updates for stakeholders
